units.title: Lentiviral vector delivery of inducible Cre and dual sgRNA cassette
units.text: we engiof ARID1B. Specifically, perturbing ARID1B expands ventral radial glia neered a lentiviral vector to deliver 4-hydroxytamoxifen-inducible CRE recombinase and a dual single-guide RNA (sgRNA) cassette (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Describes the construction and delivery of a vector for inducible genome editing.

units.title: Design of dual sgRNA construct
units.text: The dual sgRNA consists of two sgRNAs targeting the same gene, expressed under the U6 or H1 promoter. The dual gRNA is located within the 3′ (IPCs; EOMES).
units.rationale: Specifies how the dual guide RNAs are arranged for targeting a single gene.

units.title: Flow cytometry‑based gRNA reporter assay
units.text: In this assay, a pre-assembled array of gRNA-targeting sequences fused with TagBFP is used to generate interneurons with lateral ganglionic eminence (LGE) origin (LGE-IN; MEIS2) or caudal ganglionic eminence (CGE) origin (CGE-IN; NR2F2)28. into the reporter cell lines by lentiviruses. Successful genome editing causes frameshift mutations, resulting in the loss of blue fluorescent protein (BFP) fluorescence, which enables the quantitative evaluation of gRNA efficiency (Fig. 1c and Extended Data Fig. 1b,c).
units.rationale: Provides a measurable assay to assess editing efficiency of sgRNA pairs.

units.title: Construction of lentiviral plasmid library
units.text: We individually cloned sgRNA pairs and pooled them equally to construct a lentiviral plasmid library (Extended Data Fig. 3a,b). To ensure that lentiviral integration frequency was limited to one per cell, we used a low infection rate of 2.5% (ref. 18) (Extended Data Fig. 3c–e).
units.rationale: Details how a low‑multiplicity library is generated to avoid multiple integrations per cell.

units.title: Barcoding of dual sgRNA cassettes for clonal tracking
units.text: we introduced a unique clone barcode (UCB; 1.4 × 10^7 combinations) for each dual sgRNA cassette to label individual lentiviral integration events (Fig. 1a and Extended Data Fig. 4a,b). Using this strategy, we obtained an average of 2,770 bulk-extracted genomic DNA from organoid pools of four different embryoid bodies (Fig. 1e).
units.rationale: Enables identification of individual clones within pooled organoid screens.

units.title: Induction of eCas9 in early organoids
units.text: eCas9 was induced in 5-day-old embryoid bodies, followed by neural induction.
units.rationale: Specifies the timing of Cas9 activation to target early developmental stages.

units.title: FACS analysis of clone size and representation
units.text: Fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS)-based analyses we found a mean average cell number per clone of 4.4 (Extended Data Fig. 4e,f). These data suggest that cells captured in the CHOOSE screen ages throughout development, with an average of 21.8% on day 120 came from diverse and relatively small clones, which are crucial for mitigating dominant clonal effects.
units.rationale: Quantifies clone abundance to assess clonal bias in the screen.

units.title: Bulk genomic DNA sequencing for clonal distribution
units.text: Bulk analysis of the genomic DNA with a higher cell number input (50,000–150,000) revealed high clonal homogenous distribution only in uninduced cells (Extended Data Fig. 4g,h).
units.rationale: Validates uniform barcode representation in control (uninduced) samples.

units.title: Cell‑type annotation and label transfer for scRNA‑seq data
units.text: We first annotated cell clusters based on control cells (non-targeting gRNA control) and eCas9-uninduced cells (35,203 cells) (Extended Data Fig. 6d–f). Cell-type labels for the full CHOOSE dataset (49,754 cells) were then derived through a label transfer.
units.rationale: Describes the computational pipeline for assigning cell identities in the dataset.

units.title: Selection of efficient sgRNA pairs for ASD genes
units.text: selected efficient sgRNA pairs for 36 ASD genes (Extended Data Fig. 1d,e (Fig. 1f,g).
units.rationale: Identifies the final set of guide RNAs used for functional screening.
